name: Shadow play
description: Shadow play uses light and projection to tell stories – fundamentals that would evolve into cinematography. In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

key_work.title: Shadow Play [interactive]
key_work.brief_description: The discovery of fire not only banished the darkness and provided warmth to our ancestors, it also allowed them to shape their imagination by projecting shadows, which visitors can do at the entrance to The Story of the Moving Image.

constellations_primary.name: Shadow play
constellations_primary.description: Shadow play uses light and projection to tell stories – fundamentals that would evolve into cinematography. In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

start.title: Shadow Play [interactive]
start.brief_description: The discovery of fire not only banished the darkness and provided warmth to our ancestors, it also allowed them to shape their imagination by projecting shadows, which visitors can do at the entrance to The Story of the Moving Image.

end.title: Flying Down to Rio
end.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Walter Plunkett, Cyril Hume, Erwin S. Gelsey, Thornton Freeland, Irene, H.W. Hanemann and Lou Brock
end.brief_description: A dance band leader finds love and success in Brazil.

constellations_other.name: Shadow play
constellations_other.description: Shadow play uses light and projection to tell stories – fundamentals that would evolve into cinematography. In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

links.description: First used by Robert Paul in 1901, the wipe transitional effect was used throughout the silent era and into the 1930’s as a method of propelling the pace of scenes. Within Flying to Rio, horizontal wipes are used to add momentum and heighten comedy while attention passes between multiple characters.

start.title: Flying Down to Rio
start.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Walter Plunkett, Cyril Hume, Erwin S. Gelsey, Thornton Freeland, Irene, H.W. Hanemann and Lou Brock
start.brief_description: A dance band leader finds love and success in Brazil.

constellations_other.name: Shadow play
constellations_other.description: Shadow play uses light and projection to tell stories – fundamentals that would evolve into cinematography. In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

end.title: The Sting
end.creator_credit: Julia Phillips, Michael Phillips, Tony Bill, Universal Pictures, Edith Head, Albert Whitlock, George Roy Hill, David S. Ward and Zanuck/Brown Productions
end.brief_description: Set in the 1930s this intricate caper deals with an ambitious small-time crook and a veteran con man who seek revenge on a vicious crime lord who murdered one of their gang.

constellations_other.name: Shadow play
constellations_other.description: Shadow play uses light and projection to tell stories – fundamentals that would evolve into cinematography. In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

links.description: Horizontal wipes were again popularized in the 1970s with The Sting, again ultilised as a method of increasing the pace of action. The heist film, set in the 1930s, also uses title cards to create distinct chapters of the narrative as well as a nod to early cinema.

start.title: The Sting
start.creator_credit: Julia Phillips, Michael Phillips, Tony Bill, Universal Pictures, Edith Head, Albert Whitlock, George Roy Hill, David S. Ward and Zanuck/Brown Productions
start.brief_description: Set in the 1930s this intricate caper deals with an ambitious small-time crook and a veteran con man who seek revenge on a vicious crime lord who murdered one of their gang.

In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

end.title: The Empire Strikes Back
end.creator_credit: Gary Kurtz, Rick McCallum, Howard G. Kazanjian, Irvin Kershner, Richard Edlund, Ralph McQuarrie, Lucasfilm Ltd., 20th Century Fox, George Lucas, Norman Reynolds, Leigh Brackett, John Mollo and Lawrence Kasdan

video_links.name: The Empire Strikes Back: Theatrical Trailer #2
Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back - Trailer
The Empire Strikes Back: Teaser Trailer

end.brief_description: The epic saga continues as Luke Skywalker, in hopes of defeating the evil Galactic Empire, learns the ways of the Jedi from aging master Yoda. But Darth Vader is more determined than ever to capture Luke. Meanwhile, rebel leader Princess Leia, cocky Han Solo, Chewbacca, and droids C-3PO and R2-D2 are thrown into various stages of capture, betrayal and despair.

constellations_other.name: Shadow play
constellations_other.description: Shadow play uses light and projection to tell stories – fundamentals that would evolve into cinematography. In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

links.description: George Lucas created a distinct style across the Star Wars franchise through the use of his iconic opening crawls, leitmotifs and wipe transitions with 42 appearing in The Empire Strikes Back alone.

start.title: The Empire Strikes Back
start.creator_credit: Gary Kurtz, Rick McCallum, Howard G. Kazanjian, Irvin Kershner, Richard Edlund, Ralph McQuarrie, Lucasfilm Ltd., 20th Century Fox, George Lucas, Norman Reynolds, Leigh Brackett, John Mollo and Lawrence Kasdan

end.title: Romeo + Juliet
end.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, Gabriella Martinelli, Philip Martin Brown, Baz Luhrmann, Catherine Martin and Martin Brown
end.brief_description: In director Baz Luhrmann’s contemporary take on William Shakespeare’s classic tragedy, the Montagues and Capulets have moved their ongoing feud to the sweltering suburb of Verona Beach, where Romeo and Juliet fall in love and secretly wed. Though the film is visually modern, the bard’s dialogue remains.

constellations_other.name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes
constellations_other.description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.

constellations_other.name: Shadow play
constellations_other.description: Shadow play uses light and projection to tell stories – fundamentals that would evolve into cinematography. In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

constellations_other.name: Warwick Thornton
constellations_other.description: Brimming with Shakespearean undertones and pathos, Kaytetye filmmaker Warwick Thornton's debut feature Samson and Delilah is both a universal tale and one intrinsically tied to the experience of First Peoples in Central Australia.

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

links.description: Editor Jill Billcock designed the hyper-stylised opening sequence in Romeo + Juliet leading one critic to dub her a “Russian serial killer on crack”. Rapidly incorporating multiple horizontal and square iris wipes together with zooms and tightly cropped shots, Billcock set the energetic tone for film.

start.title: Romeo + Juliet
start.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, Gabriella Martinelli, Philip Martin Brown, Baz Luhrmann, Catherine Martin and Martin Brown
start.brief_description: In director Baz Luhrmann’s contemporary take on William Shakespeare’s classic tragedy, the Montagues and Capulets have moved their ongoing feud to the sweltering suburb of Verona Beach, where Romeo and Juliet fall in love and secretly wed. Though the film is visually modern, the bard’s dialogue remains.

end.title: Broad City
end.creator_credit: Jax Media, Paper Kite Productions and Comedy Central
end.brief_description: Broad City follows two women throughout their daily lives in New York City, making the smallest and mundane events hysterical and disturbing to watch all at the same time.

constellations_other.name: Shadow play
constellations_other.description: Shadow play uses light and projection to tell stories – fundamentals that would evolve into cinematography. In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

links.description: Similarly using wipes in the form of shapes for visual drama and energy, episode 5 of Broad City uses the silhouette of a foot wearing a high heel shoe to step across the screen, transitioning into the next scene of main characters Abbi and Ilana shopping.

start.title: The Empire Strikes Back
start.creator_credit: Gary Kurtz, Rick McCallum, Howard G. Kazanjian, Irvin Kershner, Richard Edlund, Ralph McQuarrie, Lucasfilm Ltd., 20th Century Fox, George Lucas, Norman Reynolds, Leigh Brackett, John Mollo and Lawrence Kasdan

But Darth Vader is more determined than ever to capture Luke. Meanwhile, rebel leader Princess Leia, cocky Han Solo, Chewbacca, and droids C-3PO and R2-D2 are thrown into various stages of capture, betrayal and despair.

end.title: Rashomon
end.creator_credit: Jingo Minoura, Daiei Film, Akira Kurosawa, Shinobu Hashimoto and H. Motsumoto
end.brief_description: Brimming with action while incisively examining the nature of truth, “Rashomon” is perhaps the finest film ever to investigate the philosophy of justice. Through an ingenious use of camera and flashbacks, Kurosawa reveals the complexities of human nature as four people recount different versions of the story of a man’s murder and the rape of his wife.

constellations_other.name: Shadow play
constellations_other.description: Shadow play uses light and projection to tell stories – fundamentals that would evolve into cinematography. In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

links.description: George Lucas was inspired to use wipes in his Star Wars films by Akira Kurosawa. This form of cinematic punctuation is closely tied to the Japanese director who himself was inspired by films of the silent era which employed wipes for visual effect and pace.

start.title: Romeo + Juliet
start.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, Gabriella Martinelli, Philip Martin Brown, Baz Luhrmann, Catherine Martin and Martin Brown
start.brief_description: In director Baz Luhrmann’s contemporary take on William Shakespeare’s classic tragedy, the Montagues and Capulets have moved their ongoing feud to the sweltering suburb of Verona Beach, where Romeo and Juliet fall in love and secretly wed. Though the film is visually modern, the bard’s dialogue remains.

end.title: Super Mario 64
end.brief_description: Being the first 3D Mario game, Super Mario 64 introduced several moves, including triple-jumping, ground-pounding, long-jumping, diving, and somersaulting, which would be used in most subsequent installments of the Super Mario series.

constellations_other.name: Shadow play
constellations_other.description: Shadow play uses light and projection to tell stories – fundamentals that would evolve into cinematography. In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

links.description: From Super Mario 64 onward many of the videogames in the series have included a Mario/Luigi-shaped iris wipe or a Bowser-shaped iris wipe depending on if the player has won or lost a level.
